articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Three men and one woman - aged between 17 and 20 - have been arrested in London and the Midlands.
articles.title: Four arrested in connection with M&S and Co-op cyber attacks

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A wide-ranging report by an intelligence committee has set out the risks Iran poses to the UK.
articles.title: UK faces rising and unpredictable threat by Iran, report warns

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The cost of all-inclusive family package holidays to many popular destinations has risen this year.
articles.title: Package holidays to Spain, Cyprus and Turkey soar in price

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Leader Kemi Badenoch will set out her plans to restrict welfare payments in a speech on Thursday.
articles.title: Ban some foreigners from sickness benefits, Badenoch urges

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A piece of the Sycamore Gap tree trunk is unveiled at its new home near Hadrian's Wall.
articles.title: Sycamore Gap tree trunk installed at The Sill

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.description: Double Olympic champion Caster Semenya wins a partial victory at the European Court of Human Rights in her long legal battle over athletics' sex eligibility rules.
articles.title: Caster Semenya: South African double Olympic champion wins partial victory at European Court of Human Rights in her long legal battle over athletics' sex eligibility rules.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The "one-in-one-out" deal with France to be announced later will have to deter people from getting in small boats.
articles.title: Migrant deal will be seen as failure if numbers don't fall

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Eight children were among 15 people reportedly killed when a queue for nutritional supplements was hit in Deir al-Balah.
articles.title: Children queuing for supplements killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, hospital says

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Residents in rural Georgia say the data centre next door has disrupted their water supply.
articles.title: 'I can't drink the water' - life next to a US data centre

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A man is convicted of murdering a dog walker while on Suffolk Police's most wanted criminals list.
articles.title: How was wanted man Roy Barclay free to kill Anita Rose?
